lines.content: Keep forgetting your tasks? Have no fear, NakiriAyame will help you keep track of them!
You're free to specify your dates as a date, or as a string describing the conditions and long enough to summon a demon.
Your Tasks are stored in a text file after every action, so your data (unlike Ayame herself) is never lost!
NakiriAyame filters and returns your Tasks by any keyword in O(1)! (Trust me, I got A+ in CS2040C)
Example of usage:  `todo Fix Ayame Ascii Art`
Expected outcome: Shows the added Todo Task. (Note the [T] to denote Todo)
Done! Added: [T][ ] Fix Ayame Ascii Art
Example of usage:  `deadline Finish ReadMe.md /by tonight`
Expected outcome: Shows the added Deadline Task. (Note the [D] to denote Deadline)
Example of usage:  `event Go for my Google Internship with Ayame (real) /from April /to July`
Expected outcome: Shows the added Event Task. (Note the [E] to denote Event)
Done! Added: [E][ ] Go for my Google Internship with Ayame (real) (From: April To: July)
Expected outcome: Mark a task as complete (Note the [X] to denote a completed Task)
Nice! I've marked this task as done!
Expected outcome: Mark a task as incomplete (Note the [ ] to denote an uncompleted Task)
Stop being lazy, get to work!
Expected outcome: Show all recorded Tasks and their status.
3.[E][ ] Go for my Google Internship with Ayame (real) (From: April To: July)
### `find [String]` - Displays for all tasks with the matching String
Expected outcome: Displays all tasks with the matching String
These are the tasks found with Keyword: Ayame
[2] [E][ ] Go for my Google Internship with Ayame (real) (From: April To: July)
Expected outcome: Deletes a specific task from the list, shows the deleted Task and the number of Tasks left
[E][ ] Go for my Google Internship with Ayame (real) (From: April To: July)

* Takes the original input and separates the first word.
* Used to determine the intended command by the user
* @param in the Scanner used to obtain the input
* @return an array of String of maximum size 2, containing the user input
* The first element in the array is the command, while the second element are the details of the input
* Checks if the queried index of the TaskList exists.
* @param input The user input. input[1] is expected to be a valid integer.
* @param indexLimit the size of the TaskList
* @return the index if it is valid, else -1 if invalid.

* Checks if the new Deadline Task for the TaskList is correctly inputted

* Else, the first element of the String array is empty if incorrectly inputted
* Checks if the new Todo Task for the TaskList is correctly inputted
* @param input The user input. input[1] is expected to be a valid String
* @return a String containing the details for the Todo Task, else an empty string if incorrectly inputted

* Takes in the stored data specified in DATA_PATH and loads them into the TaskList
* taskList will be filled if stored data is valid
* Program terminates if any invalid instructions is found in the stored data
* Will only load a maximum of 99 tasks, to prevent soft-locking.
Event newEvent = new Event(inputMessage[0], inputMessage[1], inputMessage[2]);

* Data is stored as valid instructions that will result in the exact state of the TaskList
* Called after any edits are made to the TaskList
* @param taskList the current state of the TaskList
instruction = String.format("%s %s /from %s /to %s\n", type, task, details[0], details[1]);
instruction = "Something is wrong I can feel it\n";
